metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18355 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of confusable characters in URL Formatter in Google Chrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox (URL bar) via a crafted domain name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18355` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
